He is MARTIN BLANK. We SWING AROUND behind his head to look down the barrel with him. Four-hundred yards away, on another part of the course, another green is barely visible through groves of trees and rough. Three miniscule, SILVER-HAIRED FIGURES come into view. direction.raw_text: Martin sits in a first class seat, the tray table flipped down. On the left side of the tray is a stack of magazines of all kinds - Sports Illustrated, Mademoiselle, Wired, Rolling Stone, National Review, Spin, National Geographic, and on. He draws one off the top, and flips through it, impassively taking in images and reading nothing. When he is done with one, he discards it into the empty seat next to him and draws another-- Martin's way of instantly and massively uploading the world around him: Toothless hockey player in triumph, Sony product parade, crouched starving child with vulture in the background, supermodel in suede, Tic Tacs, living former Presidents, arm in arm, smiling, etc.

THE UNITED FORCE INSTANTLY DISINTEGRATES, AND ALL 400 PEOPLE TURN THEIR GUNS ON EACH OTHER

Like King Phillip, in the 11th or 12th century who decided one day that he was so bored with his dreary life at home with his wife he thought, "Well, wouldn't it be great if we hit the road and fought... oh... the Saracens."  So he put the word out and was amazed when a million men signed up and all of them wanted to go and fight in distant lands and do terrible things to people rather than stay at home with their families.

direction.raw_text: Martin reclines in first class, soaring toward the Midwest on the red-eye. He has already scanned his magazines and they are piled in the empty seat next to him. He sets aside a Powerbar. Martin reads Kill Without Joy. After a moment, he sets the book down and takes up Iron John.

This is MARY BLANK. She suffers from Alzheimer's or something just as debilitating.

He is somewhat fatigued from the experience, but he tries once more to connect.

direction.raw_text: All right mystery man. I want some answers. Let's recap. Spring of '84. Two young lovers with frightening natural chemistry. direction.raw_text: ...About five years now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the fuck outta here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously, when I left, I joined the Army and took the service exam. They found my psych results fit a certain profile. A certain "Moral flexibility" would be the best way to describe it... I was loaned out to a CIA- sponsored program. It's called "mechanical operations." We sort of found each other...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a government spook? Martin says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was, but no... yes... I was before, but now I'm not. It's irrelevant, really. The idea of governments, nations, it's mostly a public relations theory at this point, anyway. But I'll tell you something, until about five months ago, I really enjoyed my work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I started losing my taste for it. Which usually means your time is up. But then I realized it was something entirely different... I started getting the sneaking, dark suspicion that maybe there was... meaning to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Great, Martin, that's just great. Meaning to life... Mmm....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like, that there's a point? An organic connection between all living things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me help you along, Martin. You're a sociopath!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sociopath kills for no reason. I kill for money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never could have kept this from me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's probably a good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you come with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm staying here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if I come back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll hide. She goes for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't go. She stops at the door. Slowly, she turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't get to have me. You are a monster, I'm a human being. We're not going to mate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't understand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because I speak human, and you speak monster. Debi bolts out of the room. Martin is left alone. Martin looks over at his gear on the bed. After a beat, he walks slowly over and surveys his tools. He picks up a cleaning rag and begins to go over the weapons, absently singing to himself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "What's up Doc? What's cookin'? What's up Doc, are you lookin'...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning light comes through the slit in the curtains, picking up four or five exquisitely clean guns are laid out on the bed, almost geometrically spaced. Martin lifts one at a time, checking their bores and actions...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lardner and McCullers gear up. They each finish loading the last of many clips...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grocer and Company, not in a Ford Passenger Van, veer off onto an exit ramp. Grocer has assembled a team of about nine. They draw different guns from their kit bags and begin loading...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lardner and McCullers jam clips into their service autos and knock the slides...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin finished loading his guns, and puts them in his case. He shuts it and moves for the door. On the way out he stops and looks himself in the mirror before exiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Each car whooshes by camera, on its way to the inevitable...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marcella has a cordless tucked between her shoulder and ear, and holds a two-gallon gas can. She moves from room to room pouring gasoline onto the computers, desks, and piles of paper stacked on the floor. She adds a splash to her copy of "Women Who Run With the Wolves."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm bringing down the office now. She picks up her hard drive and smashes it on the floor. It's cathartic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll put things right. Then I'll find you. Silence on the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... why? Martin finishes his weapons check, and pulls out the dossier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. I left you a little something under your desk. Martin hangs up. Marcella goes to it and pulls loose from underneath a shrink- wrapped brick of $100 bills, probably a $100,000 or so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin makes his way down the road to the Newberry's. In the distance, he sees a lone figure jogging on the shoulder, away from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grocer and Company are parked off to the side, watching Newberry, in the distance, jog toward them. A SNIPER prepares to blow Newberry's head off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he approaches the figure, he recognizes it as Newberry, he accelerates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grocer spots Martin's car speeding at Newberry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Newberry stops jogging and turns to face the Town Car bearing down on him. His face goes slack, expecting to be creamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin roars straight at Newberry, his engine shrieking. As the distance between them turns from yards to feet... Martin swerves hard, just missing Newberry and comes to a halt next to him, blocking the Sniper's line of fire. After a moment, Newberry opens the passenger door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is the matter with you?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I was hired to kill you. It's what I do, and come to think of it, I told you that, but... Okay. I'm not going to do it. Get in the car. He does. They drive on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's either because I'm in love with your daughter, or because I have a new-found respect for life. Or both. But I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grocer and company watch in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Martin's car disappearing into Newberry's long and wooded driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That punk is either in love with that guy's daughter or he has new found respect for life... Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin pulls up in front and stops. Both men scramble out and head toward the front door at a quick clip. Newberry is shaken; Martin seems at ease, at home in his element.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? I build cars! They're paying you to kill me? Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a cost-cutting effort. They can't afford a recall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a leaky sunroof! A design flaw! I reported a leaky sunroof! You want to kill me because of that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not me! Why does everybody think it's personal?! They go through the front door and shut it behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grocer drops the van into gear and heads toward the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lardner and McCullers approach the scene. They get within viewing distance in time to see Grocer's Town Car turn into the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll go in through the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin's briefcase is open on the large oak table. The contents of the dossier are spilled out onto the table. Newberry and Debi watch him, dumbstruck, as he draws a huge Desert Eagle automatic and jerks back the slide. He turns to Debi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was sitting in my house on prom night wearing that Goddamned rented tuxedo, a corsage in one hand, a bottle of champagne in the other. So I was just sitting there, and then the whole night flashed before my eyes, and it struck me like a bullet in the head-- I realized, finally, and for the first time, that... I wanted to kill somebody. So I figured because I loved you so much, that'd it'd be a good idea if I didn't see you anymore. But now I'm different. He turns and points the gun at the front door and FIRES two shots through it, leaving two baseball-size holes in the door. Martin bolts out of the room toward the back of the house. Debi and Newberry run as fast as they can away from Martin. Newberry opens the front door, preparing to rush out with Debi. They stop at what they see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & DEBI'S P.O.V. As ASSASSIN lies on the porch, shot dead through the door by Martin. IN one hand is a gun, in the other is a Fuller Brush kit. Two men, GROCER and an ASSASSIN, clamber out of van, their guns rising up fast toward us. Debi pulls Newberry inside, slams the front door, and locks it. They dive away just before ten rounds hit the door from outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin rushes toward the back door which is already opening. A barrel comes through and FIRES at Martin. Martin pulls back behind the refrigerator and returns FIRE. An ASSASSIN comes through the door in a crouch and takes cover behind the cooking island. Martin, yelling back to Debi...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in love with you. I know we can make this work!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rushes toward the island, grabbing an iron skillet off the range, and holds it up like a crossing-guard stop sign. He steps toward the hidden Assassin just as the Assassin rises SHOOTING. The skillet takes two rounds before Martin hammers the Assassin's head with it. Debi and Newberry arrive in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin bashes the skillet into the Assassin's skull, which is beyond our view. He rises spattered with blood and looks at Debi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was afraid to commit to a relationship, but now I know I'm ready to make it happen. Martin drops the skillet and grabs Newberry and Debi gently be the wrists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just need time to change. He ushers them past the bludgeoned corpse and up the back stairs. He spins and FIRES twice back down the stairs at another ASSASSIN coming up, blowing his arms off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads them quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not easy for me. I was raised to close off, to control my feelings... He takes them into a bedroom, and BLOWS AWAY, an ASSASSIN coming in through the window, emptying his auto. Martin pushes Debi and Newberry into an adjoining bathroom. He backs out through the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lock the door. They do. Martin starts away, but stops to get something straight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't raised in a loving environment. (beat) But that's not an excuse. It's a reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin corners the banister and springs half-way down the stairs, then hears the front door begin to open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My soul was empty-- Martin jams in another clip, and chambers a round. He sees Grocer beginning to slip in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and it's up to me to fill it. Martin FIRES the twelve-round clip into the door until the slide locks back empty again. Grocer backs out fast. Martin hears a gun REPORT from upstairs and moves back toward it, tossing the spent weapon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An ASSASSIN slams his body against the bathroom door while Debi and Newberry scream from within. Martin flies at him. The Assassin wheels on Martin FIRING. Martin pivots out of the line of fire, still moving forward. He takes hold of Assassin's neck and snaps it. Martin drops the corpse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. It's Martin The door begins to open revealing Debi and Newberry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what I do isn't moral, per se, but if you could just look past that, you'd see a man worth loving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't listen to him, he's a professional. Martin stops short and cocks his head toward Grocer's muffled voice coming from the vent. Grocer continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're breaking my heart down here, Blank. I can't shoot through the tears. Martin, incensed, bends down and takes the gun from the dead man. He runs out of the bedroom, gun poised for a kamikaze firefight...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lardner and McCullers are poised outside the front door, about to enter the mix. McCullers peers through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see Blank in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. For a second there I thought we were in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches the top of the front stairs to find Grocer heading up the stairs at him. They lift their guns at each other to FIRE, when they hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: power through the front door, guns BLAZING at floor-level, ala Butch and Sundance. Martin and Grocer, above, spin on them instinctively, and FIRE, killing them. Grocer dives off of the stairs and rolls out of view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INTERCUT GROCER heads up the back stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: works his way toward Grocer, moving with stealth toward the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hears him and starts back down. Martin dives behind the cooking island just as Grocer comes out of the stairwell blasting. They unload at each other as Grocer runs a pattern across the kitchen, FIRING at Martin, crouched, who BLASTS back. Grocer vaults himself through the air toward a serving window from the kitchen to the dining room, still firing. C.U. - MARTIN'S GUN - SLOW MOTION The last casing floats out of the chamber into the air, and the slide on the auto locks back-- empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flying through the air disappearing through the shuttered serving window, his flight carrying him past a television that sits on a lazy susan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INTERCUT Martin and Grocer sit on the floor, backs up against opposite side of the counter-- Martin in the kitchen and Grocer in the dining room. The hulking old television sits on the counter above and between them. Martin looks up and spies the TELEVISION GROCER ...How about I sell you two rounds for a hundred grand a piece?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Martin takes out a checkbook, and tears one free. He wads it into a loose ball and tosses it over the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sails over the television and comes down, bouncing off Grocer's head and into his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you go. I left it blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. Here they come. Grocer pulls two rounds from the clip of his semi-automatic and pushes the clip back into the gun. Grocer arcs the TWO BULLETS into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises and springs at the television, gripping it. The TWO BULLETS sail past his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins to rise from his side of the counter, cocking his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puts all his weight and motion behind the television. Martin and the television careen off of the counter toward Grocer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets off one round before
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flies onto Grocer, smashing the seventy-five pound television over his Goddamn head. Martin sails past the collision, landing on his back in the dining room. He rolls over to see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Body crumpled, neck is snapped, head encased in the shattered picture tube. He is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs up the front stairs, retrieving the spent gun he discarded earlier, and heads into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Martin opens the bathroom door. Inside, Debi sits on the edge of the tub, her face in her hands. Newberry kneels with his arms around her. Martin takes this in, and walks back into the bedroom. Newberry stands and follows him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a bloody, tattered mess, wipes off the gun and puts it into Newberry's hand. Newberry, in total shock, grips it. Martin looks past Newberry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of Debi, head in hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Debi... will you marry me? Debi doesn't look up. After a moment, she reaches out, head still down, and closes the bathroom door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside is a Michigan autumn. Debi sits at her console, bringing in the mike as she fades out of a tune...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is WRFN Radio Free Newberry cause that's what it does. Bringing you New Ones for the Nineties, a fresh new format designed to pull you out of what's come before, and reel you into what's coming soon--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lights up with an incoming cal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you what's coming soon for me, or at least what I dreamed this morning in that weird time just before you actually wake up. But first this commercial. Back after this... She pushes a couple of buttons, slaps a cartridge in a player, and answers the phone. We hear the commercial over the studio monitor:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't miss the show of the season at Bilkin Community Center! "Brigadoon!" A musical for all ages! "Brigadoon," starring Carol Plummer, Thomas Canchola, Bob Destephano, and Lee Ordman!... Debi picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Her face goes slack as she listens... not good, not bad... Then she hangs up slowly. The commercial ends. A moment of dead air, then she snaps to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey out there... Okay... I'm going to finish up that fantasy later. First I'll give you an hour of nonstop music... If I don't come back on after that-- well, nevermind. Debi turns on a reel-to-reel, and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Debi pulls up and gets out. She begins toward the door but stops dead when she sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sitting on the front steps. Debi moves slowly up the walk and sits next to him on the porch. They sit, gazing out over the grass and trees beyond. After a while...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This will never work out. She turns to him, serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You kill people. (beat)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no illusions about the future. What is, is. We make choices. And we become the sum total of our choices. I can live with that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other people can't. Martin looks at her earnestly... And smiles ever so slightly. She does the same, and then just a little wider. He the same. They turn back out to face the lawn, and they share a laugh...
direction.name: direction
